title: Extremely Lagged Fibonacci
text:
Let $(\ a_i\ )_{i=0}^\infty$ be the integer sequence such that: $$a_n =  \begin{cases} 0 & (0 \le n < k - 1) \\ 1 & (n = k - 1)\\ b \cdot a_{n-j} + c \cdot a_{n-k} & (n \ge k) \end{cases}, $$ where $j$, $k$, $b$ and $c$ are integers.For each $n, j, k, b$ and $c$, find $a_n$modulo$1\,000\,000\,037$.InputThe first line contains $T$, the number of test cases.Each of the next $T$ lines contains five integers $n, j, k, b$ and $c$.OutputFor each test case, print $a_n$modulo$1\,000\,000\,037$.Constraints$1 \le T \le 10^2$$0 \le n \le 10^9$$10^5 \le k \le 10^8$, $1 \le j < k$$1 \le b \le 10^9$, $1 \le c \le 10^9$ExampleInput:2
1000000 1 100000 1 1
1000000000 1 100000000 1 1Output:372786243
994974348
